matVTK - 3D visualization for Matlab

0.1a

Author:
Erich Birngruber <erich.birngruber 'at' meduniwien.ac.at>
for the mex functions documentation, see Files.

General idea

Extend visualization and plotting capabilities of Matlab, especially for 3D data.

Installation

Prerequisites
The Visualization Toolkit is required to build and run the mex files.
  • download and install VTK: http://www.vtk.org/
  • it uses cmake for the build process: http://www.cmake.org/
  • c++ compiler
See Readme.html in the VTK source directory on how to configure and build.

After a succesful VTK installation, set your paths for headers and includes in the makeMex.m file and run it. Alternatively you can run the DEMO.m script - it calls makeMex.m and displays some plots.

Linux

requires c++ compiler (g++), install the corresponding packages. VTK requires several OpenGL and/or Mesa libraries to be installed.

after the installation, the vtk binaries (libraries) are usually found in /usr/local/lib/vtk-x.x. Move them to /usr/local/lib. Otherwise Matlab has to be started with 

 > LD_LIBRARY_PATH="/usr/local/lib/vtk-x.x" matlab
from the command line

Mac OS X

to get the compiler, basic libraries and header files, install Xcode.

for now, configure VTK to build without cocoa support, to force an X11 window during runtime (this limitation will be fixed in the future).

after the installation, the vtk binaries (libraries) are usually found in /usr/local/lib/vtk-x.x. Move them to /usr/local/lib. Otherwise Matlab has to be started with 

 > DYLD_LIBRARY_PATH="/usr/local/lib/vtk-x.x" matlab
from the command line.

Windows (XP, Vista)

Install the free Visual Studio Express C++ for a free compiler.

The Windows SDK is needed for the stdlib headers and libs (the download says "for Windows Server 2008", but it works for XP and Vista)

set environment variables

MSSdk=C:\Program Files\Microsoft SDKs\Windows\v6.1
VS90COMNTOOLS=C:\Program Files\Microsoft Visual Studio 9.0\Common7\Tools

Add the path of the VTK binaries (.lib, .dll) to the Windows PATH variable. It can be found in bin\Release below the directory that was chosen as output directory during the cmake configuration.

for further installation hints, see http://www.vtk.org/Wiki/VTK/VTKMatlab
